Package org.opensextant.util

Utilities for Extraction

Don't get me wrong -- there are a lot of good utilities already out there for NLP work.  I found using Apache Commons StringUtils, File*Utils and other APIs very helpful.  However, there are some oddities in the Java and Unicode world that need handling, as well as in the standards world where reasonable metadata is just missing.

  • FileUtility -- provides some simpler method calls and macro-like calls for common things.  Most often used resource is just readFile(path, encoding)
  • GeodeticUtility -- simple geo math, validation and some geohash utilities
  • TextUtils and UnicodeTextUtils -- text buffer cleanup routines;  Language metadata and simple language detection. UnicodeTextUtils has Java7-specific symbol names for high order Unicode pages with items like emoticons and silly, newer stuff. 
  • GeonamesUtility -- a helper for working with country metadata: ISO, FIPS, names and codes.
  • SolrProxy -- a catch-all for interfacing with Solr index or server. The primary use cases here are interfacing Extractors with their underlying SolrTextTagger
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LuceneStopwords
    Utility class to help access Lucene stop words, mainly as they exist in Solr index stopword files are in either list form or snowball format.
    SolrProxy
    As Xponents is a multi-core instance of Solr, a single default solr home and default solr core does not make sense.
    SolrUtil
    Utility functions better suited in their own class.
